meanings.definition: Of or relating to an amoeba
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the amoebaean behavior of the tiny organism.
meanings.sent2: The pond water contained some strange, amoebaean creatures.
meanings.sent3: The classroom pet, a gelatinous blob, moved in an amoebaean manner.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as fluid and ever-changing as an amoebaean shape.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of an amoebaean world in her painting.

meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement
meanings.sent1: The jellyfish had an amoebaean appearance as it floated gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent2: The strange creature moved in an unpredictable, almost-amoebaean way.
meanings.sent3: The bouncy castle deflated into an amoebaean blob, surprising the children.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's fluid movements on stage were like an elegant, flowing amoebaean dance.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky shifted and changed shape in an ever-amoebaean manner.

meanings.definition: Characterized by constant change or fluctuation
meanings.sent1: The stock market is known for its amoebaean nature, always shifting up and down.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was as unpredictable and amoebaean as the weather.
meanings.sent3: The project timeline seemed to have an amoebaean life of its own, constantly changing.
meanings.sent4: The cityscape at night was a beautiful, twinkling, amoebaean landscape.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed in an ever-changing, amoebaean pattern through the valley.
